Less than 40% of electronic waste is recycled today in the EU and 57.6 million tons of electronic waste was generated worldwide in 2021.
Hence it is imperative to enable the extension of the life cycle of ICT network equipment through better eco-design and the increased reuse of products across the value chain.

posts.author: Pierre Barnabé
posts.content:
Innovative #semiconductor materials are essential to ensure a sustainable future. 
 
This is what we at SOITEC firmly believe and I was honoured to present our vision to make it a reality at the SEMI Europe Industry Strategy symposium #ISSEurope in Vienna on Wednesday.
 
#Sustainability, now and in the years to come, is the most important challenge and opportunity we face. That is why we have placed it at the heart of SOITECS's strategy and have developed a #SustainabilityByDesign approach to implement eco-design in our production processes.
 
To move forward on this path, we rely on the commitment and #diversity of our employees. Having a working environment with different backgrounds, skills, experience and knowledge will ensure the emergence of innovative and creative ideas.
 
This diversity is also a strength in delivering high quality solutions to our customers, bringing unique value to the mobile communications, automotive, industrial and smart device markets through our engineered wafers that deliver significant energy savings and superior performance to the end user.
 
And, as a key player in the global semiconductor industry expected to reach $1T by 2030, we are convinced that strong collaboration in the European ecosystem will enable the development of global projects, such as those we have already participated in at EU level: Beyond 5 for radio frequency electronics, Transform for sustainable #ElectricMobility and StorAIge in the development of FD-SOI technologies for #AI.
 
We are proud to promote sustainability throughout the semiconductor value chain and to advance it with the help of our partners in Europe.

posts.author: AppCyclers
posts.content: This week, we had a productive engagement with Clara Santato and  Pierre-Jean Alarco from Polytechnic Montreal on the Collaborative Research and Training Experience in Sustainable Electronics and Eco-Design (CREATE SEED). They came to discuss the potential for student mobility exchange. During their visit, we had a breakfast meeting with the Vice Chancellor and Deans of faculties of Tamale Technical University, where discussions were held on the objectives of the student mobility project, its implementation prospects, and the potency of its benefits. Professor Clara Santato also gave a fascinating presentation on CREATE SEED and the recovery of precious metals from e-waste. The highlight of the visit was a tour of the university's laboratories, where we had the opportunity to explore ways of leveraging them to achieve greater impact. This is just the beginning of an exciting journey towards sustainable electronics! #ewaste #appcyclers #createseed #TaTU  #Tamale #SustainableElectronics #EcoDesign #Collaboration #GreenInitiatives #studentmobility

posts.author: ALMASCIENCE - Beyond Paper
posts.content:
Last February 7th, Diana Gaspar and Tatiana Costa, PhD represented AlmaScience at the kick-off meeting of the REFORM project at CIDETEC facilities in San Sebastian. 
REFORM is a Horizon Europe-funded project, and it sets out to address the environmental and sustainability challenges around conventional surface-mounted and embedded functional electronics. The Project aims to accelerate and guide the development of a new European green functional electronics supply chain, through the eco-design of Building-blocks for flexible and printed electronics, which are expected to guarantee performance as well as maintain sustainability and contribute to the Circular Economy.
AlmaScience is involved in this project, and we're excited to contribute and look forward to the impactful results of this project.

No passado dia 7 de fevereiro, Diana Gaspar e Tatiana Costa, PhD representaram AlmaScience no encontro inicial do Projeto REFORM nas instalações de CIDETED em San Sebastian.
REFORM é um projeto financiado por Horizonte Europa e pretende abordar os desafios ambientais e de sustentabilidade em torno dos sistemas convencionais de eletrónica funcional embebida e de superfície. O mesmo pretende acelerar e guiar o desenvolvimento, a nível europeu, de uma nova cadeia de valor através de eco-design dos "building blocks" para aplicação em eletrónica impressa e flexível que devem não só garantir a performance, como assegurar a sustentabilidade e contribuir para a Economia Circular.
AlmaScience está envolvida neste projeto e estamos ansiosos por contribuir e ver os resultados deste projeto.
